column1: #Text=Polycrystalline TmMgGaO4 samples were synthesized through the solid-state-reaction method.
#Text=The starting materials Tm2O3, MgO and Ga2O3 were mixed in stoichiometric quantities and heated in ceramic crucibles at 1500 °C for 4 days in air.
#Text=The polycrystalline samples were then loaded in rubber tubes and compressed into rods hydrostatically at 300 MPa, which were further sintered at 1500 °C for 8 hs.
#Text=The resulting feed rods were then transferred into an optical floating zone furnace for the crystal growth.
#Text=Counter-rotation of the feed rod (24 rpm) and crystal (29 rpm) has been applied during the growth.
#Text=Large and high-quality TmMgGaO4 single crystals up to 5 cm in length can be obtained with a growth rate of 0.6 mm/h (Supplementary Note 1).
